summary: Khalid ibn al-Walid (died 642) was an Arab military leader in the 7th century. At first, he fought against Muhammad, but later converted to Islam and became a famous Muslim general. He led successful campaigns in Arabia, Iraq, and Syria, helping to spread Islam. Khalid won key battles like Yarmouk, which led to the Muslim conquest of the Levant. Despite his military genius, he faced criticism for his actions, and was eventually removed from command by Caliph Umar. Khalid is still remembered as one of the greatest generals of early Islamic history.
title: Khalid ibn al-Walid
